title.narrative: Disaster Risk Mitigation and Adaptation Project

description.narrative: The objective of the Albania Disaster Risk Mitigation and Adapation Project (AL-DRMAP) is to strengthen institutional capacities (a) to reduce Albania's vulnerability to natural and man-made hazards; and (b) to limit human, economic, and financial losses due to these disasters.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Establishment of DRM Strategy Working Group.
Establishment of the Project Management Team under TORs and with a composition satisfactory to IDA.
Execution Agreement authorized by Recipient and IEWE and legally binding upon them.
Memorandum of Understanding among Military Meteorological Service, IEWE and Air Traffic Agency enabling IEWE to provide data andforecasts on its website and setting forth data sharing arrangements.
Recipient to provide adequate budget to IEWE to enable sustainable operation of existing and new equipment supplied under project.
The Execution Agreement has been signed on behalf of the Recipient and the IEWE

target.value: New monitoring stations installed and the old ones refurbished.

actual.value: The contract for the installation of the hydromet monitoring network was signed.

title.narrative: (New Jan 2012) Institutional capacity of hydromet service strengthened through training

baseline.value: Limited access to international practices and knowledge

target.value: Training to hydromet services staff provided

actual.value: The hydrometeorological forecast training was provided to IGEWE staff.

title.narrative: (Revised Jan 2012) All systems (products, distribution system, infraastructure, regulatory framework and public awareness mechanism) ready for the launch of the catastrophe insurance

target.value: Albania becomes a member of SEEC CRIF; catastrophe products developed; regulations and website ready to support catastropheinsurance

actual.value: Albania is the first member of SEEC CRIF; catastrophe products have been developed for all SEE countries; the draft law oninsurance has been prepared and submitted for Government's approval; and three main modules of an InteractiveConsumer Awarenessand Education Website to support catastrophe insurance has been developed.

comment.narrative: Target has largely been met. All products have been developed, national draft laws on insurance prepared but they need theapprovalof all CRIF participating countries. It is expected that products and systems will be made available by 2014.

title.narrative: (Revised Jan 2012) Catastrophic risk insurance is available to businesses, households and government

target.value: CAT insurance infrastructure and regulatory framework in place.

actual.value: The CRIF has been established. Regional work on track to be completed by 2014. Activities related to catastrophic risk insurancehave progressed very well and are currently ongoing under the regional SEEC CRIF program, which will continue to be implementedafterDRMAP closure. The draft law on insurance has been prepared and submitted by the FSA to the COM to initiate the approvalprocess. Comprehensive earthquake and flood insurance packages have been fully developed with view to provide homeowners and SME’swith high credit quality coverage.

comment.narrative: The DRMAP supported the membership fee of Albania in CRIF and development of three main modules of an Interactive ConsumerAwareness and Education Website were successfully prepared and integrated into the consumers’ web application hosted by South EastEuropean Countries - SEEC CRIF (Europa RE) server.

title.narrative: Disaster risk action plan and the prioritized investment program formulated

actual.value: UNISDR expert is reviewing the draft strategy and investment plan.

comment.narrative: Target will likely be met by June 28, 2013 or shortly thereafter.

title.narrative: Emergency response equipment provided to the response units

target.value: Emergency response equipment delivered to first responders

actual.value: All equipment were procured and delivered to the respecitve units.

title.narrative: (Revised Jan 2012) Training for engineers program developed

actual.value: Training materials were developed and training was delivered in 12 prefectures. More than 1,000 practitioners were trained.

title.narrative: EU-compatible building codes, including seismic compliance developed

target.value: Revisions to building codes developed to comply with Eurocode 8

actual.value: Eurocodes 0,1,2,3 and 8 have been finalized and the technical analysis is completed. MPWT prepared training materials, includingthe National Determined Parameters specific for Albania, and disseminated the Eurocode 8 (the European building code for design ofstructure for earthquake resistance funded by the DRMAP) in all 12 prefectures in Albania.

title.narrative: (Revised Jan 2012) Revisions to Building Code, bringing them to EU standards (Eurocode 8) are ready for legal adoption

target.value: National plan of revisions developed and approved by MOPWT

actual.value: National plan of revisions of building code has been developed. A special decree has been issued by MPWT to integrate Eurocode 8,0-4 into national legislation based on the national plan. The Eurocode 8 has been prepared with project funds and Eurocodes 0,1,2,and 3 were developed with MPWT budget:they are all ready for legal adoption. In addition, the National plan of revisions ofbuilding codes has been developed and is already under implementation by the MPWT. The Plan envisages the MPWT to complete thedevelopment ofthe remaining Eurocodes (4, 5, 6, 7,and 9) and seek the Council of Ministers and Parlament approvals within about oneyear, but in light of the on-going political elections, the timeline might be longer).

title.narrative: (Revised Jan 2012) Newly produced hydrometeorological products meet WMO standards

baseline.value: Severe weather products and warnings tailored to users are not available

target.value: Hydromet data and alerts (flood and forest fire risk indexes) are disseminated to risk managers and data posted on IGEWE website

actual.value: The software for flood and wild fire monitoring was installed and daily bulletins are disseminated to GDCE. Contract for upgradingof hydromet monitoring network was signed.

title.narrative: Increased availability of weather alerts (for floods and wild fires), real time data and historical data to multiple users

baseline.value: Users do not receive tailored weather products

target.value: Fire, weather and flood forecasts distributed to users and historical data digitized

actual.value: Fire, weather and flood forecasts is distributed to users and historical data digitized
